children.subject:
If you have the time to budget into completing the labs each week, I think it's definitely worth it! Labs were honestly pretty cool and helped solidify some of the concepts we talked about each week. If you feel that your workload next semester might be too intensive and you might not have the time to budget for 16B labs, then I would say that you might be better off not doing them since they can take quite a while each week.

Also, in terms of grading, (when I took it in the spring) the no-lab option just meant that exams were weighted a bit heavier to make up for it, so that might be another factor to consider.

Took the no lab version and it’s one of the best decisions I’ve ever made. Especially if you have other classes you want to focus on and don’t want to have to deal with a lab that can take anywhere from 3-8 hours a week. It makes the class all around much more manageable and removes what is usually considered to be the worst and most frustrating part of it. Note however it will make it will likely being your grade down an could make a difference in what the final letter is but in my opinion that risk is worth it.

Note: As is fairly clear from the survey, the Spring 2021 offering will not have a "no lab" version but rather a "light lab" version where students will not receive lab kits  but will watch videos of TAs doing the labs. Studnts will be responsible for lab content (other than demonstrating that they have done the lab since they won't have kits) but not have access to significant TA support if any part of the demonstrated lab is confusing.

history.content:
There are two versions of EECS16B: the one with lab and the one without.

I wonder how will the grading of two versions be different, which version would you recommend?
history.subject: EE16B labs
